{"step_by_step_thinking": "The 'Tip of the Iceberg Phenomenon' in medical terms refers to the idea that only a small part of a health issue is visible or diagnosed, while a large part remains hidden or undiagnosed. This hidden part, the 'submerged portion' of the iceberg, can include carriers of a disease, undiagnosed cases, and people in the latent period of a disease. However, the healthy population is not part of the submerged portion of the iceberg in this context, as they do not contribute to the hidden or undiagnosed part of a health issue.", "answer_choice": "A"}
